_header: Whoso will not when he may
Note:
See Whiting (1968)
XWhiting, Bartlett Jere. Proverbs, Sentences, and Proverbial Phrases from English Writings Mainly before 1500. Cambridge, MA: Belknap, 1968, W.275; also occurs separately: see 1912.
_description: A proverbial tag in the Fasciculus Morum

BodLauMis213.Transcription: who so wilnoght whan he may&cetera
BodLauMis213.Note:
Written as prose; incomplete, ending with ‘et
                    cetera’.

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Who so woll noȝt when he mayHe schall noȝt when he
                    [wolde]
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 205.

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Wo so wul noȝt wen he mayhe sall noȝt wen he
                    wulde
Lincoln44.Note:
Followed by 3381 after
                    one Latin line.
